CatDescriptText: Mr. B.L.H. Wilson, steelmill worker, of 3406 Iowa Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taxpayers would oppose a raise in taxes to build new schools and to repair old ones which may be or might soon become fire traps?" answer reads: "In my candid opinion, the taxpayer would not oppose the raising of taxes, because it is our children whose lives are in danger in various parts of the city and the country as a whole. I know personally, that I myself do not oppose such a raise for such a worthy purpose."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of B.L.H. Wilson, wearing light colored button down overcoat, dark pinstriped double breasted suit jacket, and dark fedora, standing in front of a car with buildings in background
